meanings.definition: A person or thing that displaces.
meanings.sent1: The new machine at the factory is a displacer of the old one.
meanings.sent2: The flood acted as a displacer, forcing families to evacuate their homes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was a displacer of peace in the household.
meanings.sent4: Change can be a displacer, shaking up our routines and habits.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake was a powerful displacer of the landscape, altering it forever.

meanings.definition: To move or shift from the usual place or position.
meanings.sent1: Please do not displacer the books from their shelves.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind can displacer objects left outside.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to displacer the coin from one hand to the other.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected arrival displacer my plans for the evening.
meanings.sent5: The construction work will displacer the traffic flow in the area for a while.
